title: ReplaceAll + InSelection needs better post-replace selected-text behavior
body:
### Description of the Issue

According to this recent discussion in the Community forum...

https://community.notepad-plus-plus.org/topic/20470

...the _Replace All_ feature with _In Selection_ qualifier could work better in regards to what happens to the active selection after the replacement is finished.

Currently, what happens to the active selection is whatever Scintilla thinks should happen, because Notepad++ code for this operation does not do anything to change the selection (I know, because I single-stepped it to see).

So...we can do better; let's propose some new rules.  After a _Replace All_ + _In Selection_ operation:

* post-replace selection start = pre-replace selection start

* if replacement operation lengthens the document, post-replace selection end = pre-replace selection end + length of increase

* if replacement operation shortens the document, post-replace selection end = pre-replace selection end - length of decrease

* if replacement operation shortens the document such that all text in the pre-replace selection is eliminated, there will be no active selection post-replace

These proposed changes facilitate one situation in particular:  When this operation is recorded into a macro that does several of these in a row.  Currently, because the selection is not-particularly deterministic, this type of multiple-operation macro is not realistic.

The referenced Community topic above does a good job at describing an example, but let's repeat it here, with some small changes:

### Actual Behavior

1. Start with text `foobar`.  Select this text.
2. Do a _Replace All_ operation with the _In Selection_ checkbox ticked, with a _Find what_ of `foo` and a _Replace with_ of `FOO`.
3. Notice post-replace that the selected text is `FOObar` (good):
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30118311/102239591-064b2700-3ec5-11eb-8c08-319051d23423.png)
4. Without user-change of the current text selection, do a _Replace All_ operation with the _In Selection_ checkbox ticked, with a _Find what_ of `bar` and a _Replace with_ of `BAR`.
5. Notice post-replace that the selected text is `FOO` (not so good, probably `FOOBAR` should be the selected text):
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30118311/102239659-17943380-3ec5-11eb-91f0-3566e33f4289.png)
6. Without user-change of the current text selection, do a _Replace All_ operation with the _In Selection_ checkbox ticked, with a _Find what_ of `.+` and a _Replace with_ of `${0}!!`.  Do this with _Regular expression_ set as the _Search mode_.
7. Notice post-replace that the resulting text is `FOO!!BAR` and that nothing is selected.  This is "not so good" when one compares with the "Expected result" final text/selection:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30118311/102239348-c3894f00-3ec4-11eb-8aa7-26770f00e4c2.png)

### Expected Behavior

1. Start with text `foobar`.  Select this text.
2. Do a _Replace All_ operation with the _In Selection_ checkbox ticked, with a _Find what_ of `foo` and a _Replace with_ of `FOO`.
3. Notice post-replace that the selected text is `FOObar` (good):
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30118311/102239284-b2404280-3ec4-11eb-86c4-f54740e55506.png)
4. Without user-change of the current text selection, do a _Replace All_ operation with the _In Selection_ checkbox ticked, with a _Find what_ of `bar` and a _Replace with_ of `BAR`.
5. Notice post-replace that the selected text is `FOOBAR` (desired!):
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30118311/102239239-a5bbea00-3ec4-11eb-9122-ce25e09c3d99.png)
6. Without user-change of the current text selection, do a _Replace All_ operation with the _In Selection_ checkbox ticked, with a _Find what_ of `.+` and a _Replace with_ of `${0}!!`.  Do this with _Regular expression_ set as the _Search mode_.
7. Notice post-replace that the resulting text is `FOOBAR!!` and that that entire text is selected (desired!):
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30118311/102239182-963ca100-3ec4-11eb-9fa4-526da13a5105.png)

title: Style only the current selection/word, not all copies of identical text
body:
### Description of the Issue
When styling text using _Search_ > _Mark All_ > _Using_ **Nth** _style_ , I'd like to be able to color ONLY the text I currently have selected, or only the current word at the caret if no selection is active.  This goes against the menu item's "Mark **ALL**" concept but in certain circumstances it can be valuable to do this.  One circumstance is when copying styled text to the clipboard and wanting to avoid redundant data.

Some other user requests for this:

* https://community.notepad-plus-plus.org/topic/20466
* https://community.notepad-plus-plus.org/post/59207

I alluded to the user needing this feature when I added the "Copy Styled Text" capability to Notepad++ via this issue and its PR:  #8943 , specifically in these comments:

- https://github.com/notepad-plus-plus/notepad-plus-plus/issues/8943#issuecomment-702878124
- https://github.com/notepad-plus-plus/notepad-plus-plus/issues/8943#issuecomment-702862998


### Steps to Reproduce the Issue
<!--- Set of steps to reproduce this issue -->
1. Create some text in a Notepad++ tab:
```
Jack and Jill
Went up the hill
To fetch a pail of water
Jack fell down
And broke his crown,
And Jill came tumbling after.

Up Jack got
And home did trot,
As fast as he could caper;
And went to bed
And plastered his head
With vinegar and brown paper.

When Jill came in
How she did grin
To see Jack's paper plaster;
Mother vexed
Did whip her next
For causing Jack's disaster.
```

2. Place the caret inside the word `Jack` in the first line
3. Invoke _Search_ menu > _Mark All_ > _Using 1st style_
4. Observe all occurrences of `Jack` are styled in the cyan color:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30118311/102022794-29f05f00-3d57-11eb-933e-9c573ba7f4f7.png)

### Expected Behavior
I expected a way to have only the currently selected text, or the current word at the caret, to be styled with one of the five styling colors, not all prior and future instances of the text.

### Actual Behavior
All occurrences of identical text were styled with the color I chose.  This was not what I needed.

title: [Feature Request] More obvious way to do bookmark manipulation
body:
Recently some users have complained that the location of the bookmark manipulation commands is too far removed from one of the primary methods for auto-setting of bookmarks, the _Mark_ tab in the _Find_ window.

Located in the _Search_ menu under the _Bookmark_ submenu, multiple users have said that it would make more sense to have bookmark handling commands right on the _Mark_ tab because it takes too much "menuing around" to access these commands.

And while all of the bookmark commands are able to be mapped to shortcut keycombos to avoid the "menuing around", no one really wants to try to remember many new keycombos.

I personally don't think these commands belong on the _Mark_ tab of the _Find_ window.  I think a much better thing to do is to have a context menu with the bookmark commands show itself when the user right-clicks the bookmark margin.

The entire Bookmark submenu, if popped up on right-click, would very useful and intuitive.  (Okay, so maybe _Toggle Bookmark_ isn't really worth it, since that's the behavior of a left-click on the bookmark margin.)  _Next_ and _Previous_ are very handy, as are _Copy_, _Cut_ and _Inverse_.

Original user complaints may be found at this [LINK](https://community.notepad-plus-plus.org/topic/19404).

Feature request based off of behavior current to N++ 7.8.6

Reference image of existing _Search_ > _Bookmark_ menu:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30118311/82962850-5e552700-9f8f-11ea-92fb-087e15a61d1a.png)

title: "Purge for each search" option for "Mark All" action should respect "In selection" option
body:
### Description of the Issue

As hinted at in a comment to #6271...

The `Purge for each search` option, when selected, will cause all marks in a document to be removed when a new `Mark All` operation is performed.  Normally this is the desired behavior.  However, if the `In Selection` option is also chosen, the marking operation should respect that and only purge the marks in the selection before marking the newly-specified text (also limited to the current selection).

### Steps to Reproduce the Issue

1. Copy the following text into a new Notepad++ tab:

```
Jack and Jill
Went up the hill
To fetch a pail of water
Jack fell down
And broke his crown,
And Jill came tumbling after.

Up Jack got
And home did trot,
As fast as he could caper;
And went to bed
And plastered his head
With vinegar and brown paper.

When Jill came in
How she did grin
To see Jack's paper plaster;
Mother vexed
Did whip her next
For causing Jack's disaster.

```
2. Invoke the Mark dialog.
3. Untick all checkboxes; tick Wrap around checkbox.
4. Put `Jack` in Find what box.
5. Press Mark All button.  Note the marking that occurs throughout the document.
6. Select the entire first "paragraph" aka the first 6 lines.
7. Tick the `In selection` checkbox in the Mark dialog.
8. Tick the `Purge for each search` checkbox in the Mark dialog.
9. Put `Jill` in Find what box.
10. Press the `Mark All` button.

### Expected Behavior
Because `In selection` and `Purge for each search` are ticked, I expect the `Mark All` button to only clear marking in the selected text before running the new mark operation.

This should be what it looks like after Step 10:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30118311/69551344-8923db80-0f6a-11ea-8358-3503b0c04cae.png)

### Actual Behavior

title: Count / ReplaceAll / MarkAll option "In Selection" should not be available with multiple selections
body:
### Description of the Issue

The Count / ReplaceAll / MarkAll functions of the Find window allow a user to specify "In Selection" with multiple selections active.  Logically, this makes sense, but those functions only deal with a single "main" selection.  Until such a time when those functions are expanded to allow true multiple selection counting/replacing/marking, "In Selection" should not be allowed as a choice when multiple selections are active, because Count / ReplaceAll / MarkAll will affect a different amount of text than the user expects.

### Steps to Reproduce the Issue
<!--- Set of steps to reproduce this issue -->
1. Make sure that `Multi-Editing Settings` are enabled in the Preferences' `Editing` area:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30118311/68522510-03b9df00-027a-11ea-9a5b-d142733ab65a.png)

2. In a new Notepad++ tab, paste the following text:
```
aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa
aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa
aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa

aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa
aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa
aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa
```
3. Use the mouse to select the first three lines. This is now the "main" selection, as it is the only selection:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30118311/68522548-4d0a2e80-027a-11ea-8e7e-40c28f81d0b1.png)
4. Hold Ctrl and select (with the mouse) the last three lines into a second selection.  This is now the "main" selection as it is the most recently made selection:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30118311/68522559-775bec00-027a-11ea-9f6f-5194f7452812.png)
5. Invoke the Mark dialog from the Search menu and set it up as follows:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30118311/68522572-ad00d500-027a-11ea-82cb-ae537240351e.png)
6. Press the `Mark All` button and observe the results.

### Expected Behavior

I expected every `a` in *both* active selections to be marked.

### Actual Behavior
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30118311/68522590-d7eb2900-027a-11ea-9f39-8166f5854568.png)
Only the `a`s on the last three lines (the current "main" selection) have been marked.  This is confusing to the user as there are clearly `a`'s in a selection that didn''t get marked.  This confusion could be avoided by disallowing `In selection` as a choice when multiple selections are active, much like it is disallowed when a rectangular selection is active.

### Debug Information

Build time : Oct  7 2019 - 00:58:16

Admin mode : OFF

### Notes

MarkAll was used as an example, but Count and ReplaceAll work similarly with multiple selections.

title: Simple UX Improvement - Recent Files Vertical Alignment
body:
Users who use Recent files extensively will know this pain very well, especially if they have a deep nested structure of folders.

In a long list of recent files, finding the one you want is a giant pain, because the most important part - the filename itself - is not in vertical alignment. Your eyes have to zig-zag instead of quickly scan straight down a list.

Three possible solutions:

1) Put the filename on the left side of the menu, with the folder in brackets (this method is preferred as the folder names align more logically than in 2):
```
1: filename.xyz (C:\foo\bar)
2: filename.123 (D:\bar\foo\bar)
```

2) Right-align the files/folder list instead of the current left-alignment. This way the filenames are all aligned:
```
1: --- C:\foo\bar\filename.xyz
2: D:\bar\foo\bar\filename.123
```

(late edit option # 3) Don't list the containing folder, and put the full path+file in a tooltip (LibreOffice-style):
```
1: filename.xyz
2: filename.123
```


Below is what I'm looking at right now. It's extremely cumbersome and easily improved:

![Untitled](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14173022/67607831-b8141b00-f73a-11e9-9b6d-d0fae0c23a9e.png)

title: Trailing indent indicators continue to following code blocks even if there is no indent
body:
When indentation is more than one level deep, the vertical dotted indentation markers appear. This is nice, but it does not accurately reflect the actual indentation.

This issue is of particular interest when using python, but it is probably valid for other language with syntactical whitespace like YAML perhaps.

Consider the following python snippet, for example,
```
if example:
	if nest:
		do_stuff()
#
# The indents are removed here and there are two newlines
if example2:
	if nest:
		do_stuff()
#
# same here, two newlines then EOF, no actual indent
```
The result looks like:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/35270292/59945067-0d0df080-942c-11e9-9675-f208bba10e34.png)

As you can see in the image, even though there isn't actually any indentation, the vertical indicator remains until the next line of code or EOF.

As much as I hate using VSCode, I believe they did it right:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/35270292/59944732-28c4c700-942b-11e9-8656-c8c0eae0d2f5.png)

I personally have admittedly odd spacing habits, but the way indentation indicators inexorably trail blocks of code makes reading larger files a bit more difficult, and gets ~~exponentially, in my opinion,~~ more difficult with each level of indentation a block of code contains.

title: Non-blocking find/replace actions
body:
Hello,

the work Notepad++ does triggered by the find-and-replace dialog should be done in a worker thread and should be cancelable.

This is because such actions can sometimes last very long and can even cause you to think the GUI will never respond again and to force-terminate the program. This is especially true for large files.

If there's a way to get this information, there should even be a progress bar. Alternatively, the information of the last processing time would be valuable, if it's a long one.

An optional sound after long operations would also be appreciated.

---

Related issue: https://github.com/notepad-plus-plus/notepad-plus-plus/issues/365

---

Because the find-and-replace dialog already has many buttons, probably there shouldn't be added an additional <q>Cancel</q> button. Because it makes sense to cancel a running action before closing the dialog, the <q>Close</q> button could turn into a <q>Cancel</q> button while an action is running.

The following image is an illustration of how the progress could be indicated. It shows the bottom of the find-and-replace dialog.

![gui](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13482553/9569523/7f443238-4f6e-11e5-9543-c2d313780c8f.png)

The remaining time should appear as soon as enough data was gathered for a non-jumping presentation (short fixed amount of time?) and only if it's greater than or equal to 2 seconds at this point.

---

The developer of the PCRE2 library told me via e-mail that he is implementing an end offset feature for the functions `pcre2_match()` and `pcre2_substitute()` that would allow progress features (see issue https://github.com/notepad-plus-plus/notepad-plus-plus/issues/816). Because it would be a huge performance hit to do additional progress-related processing on every character position of the subject string, one should let the library process the string repeatedly from a start offset to an end offset and do progress-related processing between those calls. (Example: Try to match starting from offsets 0 to 100, update progress controls, try to match starting from offsets 101 to 200, and so on.)

Because the processing time of different regular expressions can differ very much, the application should first process a short range of the subject string and see whether the PCRE2 function returns quickly. If it returned quickly, the length of the ranges processed at once can be increased. This way, the length can be leveled out at a frequency of, say, 20 Hz (50 ms between GUI updates).

<sup>_Old text about conversation with the developer:_
When having [switched to the PCRE2 library](https://github.com/notepad-plus-plus/notepad-plus-plus/issues/816), the functions `pcre2_match()` and `pcre2_substitute()` are able to provide progress information by means of callouts. At the time of this writing (2015-09-17), it is already possible with the `pcre2_match()` function, and the PCRE2 developer told me via e-mail that he <q>is considering a new callout that would perhaps make global substitution progress easier to implement when `pcre2_substitute()` is used.</q></sup>

<sup>Of course, a worker thread is still necessary, because single matches between the callouts can still last very long. (For your information: The PCRE2 developer also mentioned <q>the <q>match limit</q> feature to limit the amount of work done.</q> But I think a worker thread is the only opinion for Notepad++.)</sup>

title: UDL support for number-containing keywords inside delimiters
body:
In the UDL module, keywords which contain numbers take on correct format outside of delimiters such as parentheses. However, inside parentheses number formatting seems to override keyword formatting if both are allowed to be nested.

![code example](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13697650/9141596/8b89fbee-3cff-11e5-8e2f-c8abbd1fc16d.PNG)
This segment should format the keyword $3 the same as $1, both are explicitly listed in the same keyword group and $3 formats just fine outside of parentheses. Both the keyword group and numbers are checked in the parentheses delimiter nesting options.

![code example2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13697650/9141664/0a432910-3d00-11e5-9a26-95bde372c3aa.PNG)
The above segment shows $3 formatted correctly outside of parentheses with a number correctly formatted inside the parentheses.

The issue seems to come down to keywords taking priority over numbers outside of delimiters while numbers take priority over keywords inside delimiters. 

![code example3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13697650/9141775/b043dbde-3d00-11e5-9902-717f3d0a92d8.PNG)
Setting the keyword group on prefix mode formats the keywords such as $3 correctly inside parentheses as show in the above segment. However it formats any adjacent following symbol as a number (such as the comma in this segment) and tends to break code folding as delimiters and operators are turned into numbers.

![code example4](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13697650/9141816/0cfefaa2-3d01-11e5-91ca-c5c0c7fe6f86.PNG)
This final line of code shows all components formatted as they should be with both keywords and numbers nested inside parentheses.

title: COBOL comment on column 7
body:
The COBOL parser doesn't make a comment green if there is a character just before the star (*).

In my environment, we put tags everywhere, and most of them have 6 characters, so most of the COBOL comments are not correctly parsed in Notepad++, and this creates a big confusion sometimes.

It is perfectly valid to have a tag of 6 characters and a star (*) just after that, and that should be parsed as a comment.

![sshot-2015-06-21-22-21-27-1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/487079/8273402/e036598c-1863-11e5-8eaf-074fb33129f2.jpg)

Thank you,
Nuno

title: Please fix this: <?php_egg_logo_guid
body:
In php when starting a new document, or simply typing <?php, notepad++ will automatically suggest php_egg_logo_guid. This may not be considered as a bug, I am merely requesting that some kind of functionality to recognize if the <?php start tag is used, before suggesting php_egg_logo_guid to be added.

Steps to reproduce this problem:
1. Create a php document
2. Start the php tag by typing <?php
3. hit enter (here it will have added the suggestion to the code.)

Steps to avoid the problem:
3. instead of pressing enter, just press space and then enter.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12991239/8273408/a74f8b76-186c-11e5-9507-43ca43b5ce78.png)

It may seem like a rather simple thing, but it's actually so annoying that I'm about to find an alternative to notepad++. So please, help me with this issue, I am literally begging.

title: Support multiple themes for external lexers.
body:
Currently, an external lexer needs to supply an .xml file with the language's token and their relevant styles.

e.g.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2955627/8160745/7314ec88-1372-11e5-8371-2808bce27f68.png)

While this works, the problem, or rather inconvinience is, that if the user selects a different theme, he has to change all the coloring. 

For the already integrated languages this is not the case. There are multiple styles for multiple themes under ..\AppData\Roaming\Notepad++\themes

There for every theme, all the supported languages are defined, so each language has it's own settings for any given theme.

Please enable this functionality for external lexers as well.
